content: I think there should be a hotkey to expand/condense long messages.
yeah, that's a nice idea
We need a hotkey for this! Any suggestions? (open issue #4540)
Currently, Tim has suggested o.
I'll push back and say that this doesn't warrant a specific hotkey. Is there a way to do this through the menu (which has a hotkey already)?
There is, but it's like the 3rd thing in the menu, and I think this is the kind of feature where the value does vary depending how convenient it is
H, referencing "Hide body", could make sense
Why not make it the first thing in the menu?
That's currently "edit message", which is probably more common
Do we have a hotkey for "edit current message"? I know we have left-arrow, but that's slightly different.
It's i + enter
I think we could move that to e and then reorder the menu, I suppose

The interesting thing about collapse is that you almost never do it, but if a message is too long, there's like a 90% chance of doing it. So there are two things at play:

  • the utility of the action is very context-sensitive
  • you're not likely to use the hotkey enough to internalize it

Use cases like this make me want to have a quick-jump that is context-aware.
But mainly I just don't think the hotkey here is useful enough, given that we have some "scarcity" of available keys.
We auto-collapse really long messages (correctly again now, I think?), so it's mostly I think for messages with a potentially animated image you don't want to look at, I think?
Yes we auto-collapse them
Yeah, I think the more common task is to expand, actually. But even that is pretty rare.

And I feel like most of the time we have long messages, it's a code sample, so I'd want to discuss that specific use case (e.g. possibly have a feature that zooms to the message in a popup rather than merely expanding it).
It's also worth mentioning that we can have shortcut characters in all of our popup menus that are only active when you open the menu. Microsoft has had that feature since the 90s.
http://www.helpwithpcs.com/software/microsoft-word/file-menu.gif
Ah, the underlined letters right?
yup
